column5: This past summer I met member Gerritt and in discussion I had mentioned that the 1st place my Dad took me fishin was Calendonia back in the 60's  I recalled a mill there and he indicated that it was still there.  When I took on a new project I thought--why not---it was definetely a big part of my life.  So on Misfish' advice--I checked the expiry on my artistic licence and set forth  I have'nt seen the mill or river in many years so an exact likeness on my memory would have been not really close---so I went with the feeling of the day.  Man life was alot simpler then.  My Father passed away in 72 but I took what he taught me and spent that same quality time with my kids.  Short of a few highlites this is pretty much done  Bushart

That there is real nice Bushy!!!  ... and I almost crapped my pants when I saw your avatar!!!  ... what're you doing with those bright colors in that painting???... you coming out of you "blue period" or something?... whatever it is, I like it!!!
Very nice......filled with and driven by memories......
Thanks Dawg---ya know if you had our beer prices you'd be blue also  Bushart
Wow! Looking nice and not far off!    some more info... http://creepycaledonia.org/story11.aspx  Great story behind you're painting as well.  G
Beer is for the lessers Bushy!  I really dig the Black label Cuban Rhum up there... your cigarette prices would make me a pauper in a matter of days!
K now she's Done  I went to put the final highlites in and of course made a couple additions---like wire shadows---lite-post and sign  Now just have to sign  Bushart
Wow, that's FANTASTIC bushart!!!  And the memories and times that you drew on for you inspiration is quite a story in itself.
Beautiful painting Bushart Looking at Gerrit's pic and your painting, I think your recollection of the place was pretty bang on!!! Thanks for sharing your memories Leechman
Nice work there Bushart! Really like the avatar painting, do you have larger version of avatar? The fall colours are appropriate now.
